description:
'''The Chemical Brothers''' are an English [[electronic music]] duo formed by Ed Simons and Tom Rowlands in [[Manchester]] in 1992. They were pioneers in bringing the [[big beat]] genre to the forefront of [[pop culture]].

Originally known as The Dust Brothers, they changed their name due to the existence of [[Dust Brothers|another band with the same name]]. Their first album ''[[Exit Planet Dust]]'' sold over one million copies and debuted at No. 9 on the [[UK Albums Chart]]. After attracting [[Virgin Records]], the duo achieved further success with their second album ''[[Dig Your Own Hole]]'' (1997), which topped the [[UK Albums Chart|UK chart]]. They have had six No. 1 albums and 13 top-20 singles in the UK, including two chart-toppers. They have won six [[Grammy Awards]], including [[Best Rock Instrumental Performance]], [[Best Dance Recording]], and [[Best Dance/Electronic Album]].
